alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 2:32PM MDT until April 12 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEAST NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM THURSDAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO AS WELL AS THE SOUTHWEST MOUNTAINS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Southwest winds are on the uptrend today, but will increase further on Thursday. Strengthening winds will combine with low humidity, above normal temperatures and an unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions over northeast New Mexico through this evening and over a wider area Thursday afternoon and evening. Critical fire weather conditions may return on Friday across east central New Mexico as well. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) through this evening and from midday Thursday through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 or 40 mph this afternoon. Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to near 50 mph Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from near 7 to 10 percent this afternoon and 8 to 13 percent Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
